items.name: 1033-native PFM or switching hub for regional banks
items.why_now: CFPB 1033: first compliance April 1, 2026 for largest banks ($250B+ assets); staggered through 2030. APIs replace screen-scraping (50s faster, 96–99% uptime). Plaid/Yodlee are aggregators; gap is bank-owned or white-label switching/aggregation for regionals.
items.description: Build a consumer-facing PFM or account-switching product that consumes 1033 APIs and sells to regional banks (below $250B) or credit unions as they approach 2027–2030 deadlines. Target: US banks $10B–$250B assets (hundreds of institutions) needing a compliant, branded data experience.
items.target_segment: Regional US banks and credit unions ($10B–$250B assets); first wave 2027–2028 compliers.
first_steps: Map 20–50 target institutions by asset size and current data partner (Plaid/Yodlee/none).
Prototype a minimal 1033 consumer consent + balance/transaction API integration with one test bank.
Pitch as white-label “1033 readiness” bundle: consent UX + aggregation layer.

items.name: AI SDR + revenue intelligence for $75K–$200K ACV vertical SaaS
items.why_now: AI-native sales tools show 241% ROI vs 87% non-AI; 89% of B2B use AI sales tools but only 42% hit ROI—gap in execution. Deal cycle drops 28% with AI; $187/rep/month stack cost. Harvey/EvenUp prove vertical AI at $1B+ valuations; mid-ACV verticals (legal, insurance, logistics) still under-penetrated.
items.description: Vertical SaaS that bundles AI SDR (outreach + qualification) with revenue intelligence (at-risk deal detection) for one vertical (e.g. legal, insurance, or logistics) at $75K–$200K ACV. Compete with horizontal tools (Fuse, Throxy, Gong) by owning the vertical workflow and data model.
items.target_segment: B2B SaaS companies in legal, insurance, or logistics with 5–30 reps and $75K–$200K ACV; ~10 reps per $10M ARR.
first_steps: Pick one vertical; interview 15 sales leaders on current stack (CRM, SDR, outreach) and pain (e.g. at-risk deals, reply rates).
Build a narrow MVP: AI-generated outreach + one “at-risk deal” signal from CRM data; validate with 3–5 design partners.
Price at $150–250/rep/month; position as “vertical revenue intelligence” not generic SDR.

items.name: EU business-to-consumer messaging interop layer (DMA)
items.why_now: DMA in force March 7, 2024; Meta’s reference offer for WhatsApp/Messenger interop uses Signal Protocol. Third-party providers can connect via contract; group chat interop within 2 years, voice/video within 4 years. First movers can offer “one inbox” for SMBs or consumers who need to reach WhatsApp/Messenger users from a different app.
items.description: Build a B2C or SMB-facing product that lets users or businesses receive and send interoperable messages with WhatsApp/Messenger users from a single inbox (e.g. privacy-focused or vertical app). Target EU first; consent required on both sides; “Third-party chats” section in WhatsApp is live.
items.target_segment: EU consumers or SMBs (e.g. support, local services) who need to interact with WhatsApp/Messenger users without using Meta apps; privacy-conscious or vertical segments.
first_steps: Review Meta’s technical reference offer and BEREC opinion; identify minimal compliance path (E2E text + files first).
Build a minimal “bridge” app: connect via Meta’s interoperability API; one inbox for third-party chats; onboard 100 beta users in one EU country.
Partner with one vertical (e.g. healthcare or legal) where WhatsApp is dominant but compliance demands audit trail; position as “compliant interop inbox.”

items.name: 1033-powered credit underwriting for thin-file SMBs
items.why_now: Same April 2026+ 1033 rollout; standardized bank-account and transaction data via API (not screen-scraping) enables reliable cash-flow underwriting. Lenders can pull 12–24 months of transaction data with consent; 96–99% API uptime reduces drop-off.
items.description: Lending or underwriting API for SMB lenders (or embedded in neobanks) that uses 1033 consumer-authorized data to score thin-file or new-to-credit SMBs. Sell to community banks, CDFIs, or fintech lenders who lack robust data pipelines.
items.target_segment: US SMB lenders and CDFIs underwriting businesses with thin credit files; first product by Q2 2026.
first_steps: Integrate with one 1033-ready data provider (Plaid or Yodlee) for business checking/transaction data.
Define a minimal cash-flow score (e.g. 6-month inflows/outflows); backtest on historical dataset or partner data.
Pilot with 1–2 community banks or CDFIs; position as “1033-native underwriting” for SMB.

items.name: Consolidated AI sales stack for mid-market (single vendor)
items.why_now: 73% of teams waste $2,340/rep/year on overlapping tools; AI-native tools deliver 2.8x ROI (241% vs 87%). No single vendor owns “AI SDR + CRM + revenue intelligence” for $50K–$500K ACV; point solutions (Fuse, Gong, Outreach) force integration burden.
items.description: Single-vendor stack: AI SDR (outbound + reply handling), lightweight CRM, and revenue intelligence (at-risk deals, forecasting) for mid-market. Target 10–50 rep teams; replace 3–5 tools with one contract. Price $200–300/rep/month.
items.target_segment: B2B companies with 10–50 sales reps and $50K–$500K ACV; industries with long cycles (professional services, manufacturing).
first_steps: Survey 30 mid-market RevOps/Sales leaders on current stack cost and overlap; quantify “tool sprawl” and willingness to consolidate.
Build an integrated MVP: AI SDR (email + LinkedIn) + pipeline view + one at-risk-deal alert; 5 design partners at $200/rep/month.
Go-to-market as “one stack, one contract” with migration playbooks from Salesforce/HubSpot + Outreach/Gong.
